#summary HOWTO Build.

=== Introduction ===

Basically we follow the same process than Tamarin<br>
see [http://developer.mozilla.org/En/Tamarin_Build_Documentation Tamarin Build Documentation]

=== OS X ===

the *redshell_d* (debug) executable is compiled with
 {{{
$ xcodebuild -project platform/mac/shell/shell.xcodeproj -configuration Debug
 }}}

or

 {{{
$ cd redtamarin-trunk/src
$ mkdir objdir-release
$ cd objdir-release
$ python ../configure.py --enable-shell --enable-debugger
$ make
 }}}


but the release *redshell* is compiled with make+gcc
{{{
$ cd redtamarin-trunk/src
$ mkdir objdir-release
$ cd objdir-release
$ python ../configure.py --enable-shell
$ make
...
}}}

I release only i386, ping me if you want PPC or simply use
{{{
$ xcodebuild ARCHS=ppc -project platform/mac/shell/shell.xcodeproj
}}}

files released are *redshell* and *redshell_d*

=== Windows ===

if you got problem by retrieving the zlib with
{{{
$ hg clone http://hg.mozilla.org/mozilla-central mozilla-central
$ mkdir modules
$ xcopy /s/e mozilla-central\modules\zlib\*.* modules\zlib
}}}

you can also try
{{{
cvs -d :pserver:anonymous:anonymous@cvs-mirror.mozilla.org:/cvsroot
 export -r HEAD mozilla/modules/zlib
}}}

setup your directories like this
{{{
..
  |_ modules
  |      |_ zlib
  |           |_ ...
  |
  |_ redtamarin-trunk
       |_ src
}}}

and just open the solution in Visual Studio,<br>
it should compile without any changes

files released are *redshell.exe* and *redshell_d.exe*


=== Linux ===

compiled with make+gcc (same as OS-X)

but if you obtain an error because the zlib is missing

download the zlib http://www.zlib.net/zlib-1.2.3.tar.gz

{{{
$ sudo mv ~/Desktop/zlib-1.2.3 /user/include/zlib
}}}

also install the zlib dev lib
{{{
$ sudo apt-get install zlib1g-dev
}}}

and with make
{{{
$ cd redtamarin-trunk/src
$ mkdir objdir-release
$ cd objdir-release
$ python ../configure.py --enable-shell --enable-zlib-include-dir=/usr/include/zlib
$ make
...
}}}

files released are *redshell.nix* and *redshell_d.nix*

=== building by-hand on the command-line ===

1. compile the abc files
{{{
 $ cd redtamarin-trunk/src/core
 $ ./builtin.py
}}}

{{{
 $ cd redtamarin-trunk/src/shell
 $ ./shell_toplevel.py
}}}

2. compile
{{{
 $ cd redtamarin-trunk
 $ cd src
 $ mkdir objdir-release
 $ cd objdir-release
 $ python ../configure.py --enable-shell
 $ make
 ...
}}}
